description: {"blocks":[{"key":"634fq","text":"CODEX system is the combination of an (1) oligo-nucleotide based antibody labeling-detection technique, (2) a microfluidics instrument coupled with an inverted microscope capable of whole slide scanning, and an (3) ImageJ-based analysis platform. This experimental setup allows the automation of immunofluorescence signal detection across several staining cycles of a single tissue section","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s6p","text":"This protocol describes detailed methods used in CODEX imaging experiments at the Laszik Lab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer:

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6980f","text":"QA/QC Parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekli1","text":"1. Visual inspection of whole slide digital images of the stains. Every stain (channel-target) in each section is visually evaluated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2co","text":"2. Positive controls. A positive control stain is performed with each CODEX stain on a “control” kidney with inflammation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chsiq","text":"3. Automation. Using standardized operator-independent automated validated protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51jdo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6le9v","text":"CODEX data quality management processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75rpf","text":"All CODEX data generated go through a rigorous quality control process that includes visual assessment of the processed images and a review of the segmented files, both test specimens and on slide controls. In addition to the stains, cellular and compartmental segmentation fidelity is key to downstream analysis. Unexpected staining pattern and/or artifacts on the processed images are documented; if correctable, such as those related to folding or edge artifact among others, the images are manually annotated to define regions that could be rescued for analytics. If corrective measures are not an option, such as that with a failed stain the data for that particular stain will be excluded from the analysis. Segmented images, both with cellular and compartmental segmentation are also reviewed for accuracy; once again, if abnormal/unexpected segmentation is detected, depending on the nature of such finding either corrective measures are implemented or the case/stain is flagged and excluded from further analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8vj5","text":"Launch the CODEX Instrument Management Software and enter cycle, marker id and exposure time information. Minimize the window.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eptop","text":"Place the plate with the CODEX-tagged dyes in its designated place in the instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e92am","text":"Clean any dried buffer on the bottom of the stained coverslip with a wet kimwipe and dry off any residual liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d6eds","text":"Turn on the Keyence scanner and load the cassette into the scanner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76q0v","text":"Select the following Keyence settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38jsq","text":"Turn on all fluorescent channels. Set to white.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4jpd","text":"Low photobleach","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gt23","text":"Mono","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aktg7","text":"High Resolution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qndj","text":"X20 air objective","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57jst","text":"XY-stitching","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1toro","text":"Z-stack","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ootk","text":"Set center and number of images/Set Edge Points","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6kjrt","text":"Navigate the sample using the DAPI channel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"atg4n","text":"Use the “Navigation” window to capture regions of the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dscis","text":"Click upper and lower limit to keep z-stack in range.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bu5qb","text":"Set the pitch for the z-stack. ( )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9noh4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error":false,"guid":"2D2D3D90F5FE11EBBAF41762E6F8E219","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":202,"value":"1.5"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"85uut","text":"Click “Start Capture” to set up location to save image files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cikfb","text":"Switch back and maximize the CODEX Instrument Management window and click \"Start Experiment\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57lb3","text":"Raw CODEX image data is transferred from acquisition computer to the processing computer using “Transfer Data” feature from CODEX Instrument Manager. Image processing pipeline includes two main components prior to image analysis; (1) image processing and (2) quality control steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"333cv","text":" tiles","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26ivf","text":"Background subtraction","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9hlvm","text":"Deconvolution","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4knr7","text":"Shading experiment image data","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53fhn","text":"Quality control gating to eliminate artifacts","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13d5t","text":"Generate populations based on unsupervised clustering or manual gating","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8abip","text":"Import and export annotated populations for downstream analysis","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cs7k","text":"Image processing: This is a fully automated and standardized protocol currently running on Akoya’s processor version 1.7.0.6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ef6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"85d66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"214F68D0F5FF11EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":449.0636363636363,"id":223197,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d0k6a","text":"CODEX image processing options available through current processor version 1.7.0.6","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 5.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g389bbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g387bbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g388bbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g386bbgep.webp","width":415.10084033613447}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jqa0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dfte5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2EAFA260F5FF11EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":453.4636363636362,"id":223201,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ehde7","text":"CODEX image processing options available through current processor version 1.7.0.6","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 6.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39dbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39bbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39cbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39abbgep.webp","width":419.1680672268904}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q6r2","text":"Image alignment across cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23s07","text":"To ensure positional consistency for reliable marker expression assessment, tissue displacement is corrected using 3D phase correlation. For each cycle, the nuclear stain pattern is compared to that of the reference cycle, which by default is DAPI of the second cycle. The calculated offsets are used to align all cycles using rigid translation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3ffk","text":"Background subtraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fher","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf884","text":"Auto fluorescence from each channel is eliminated using signal from blank cycles at the beginning and end of the run. Carry over signal from one cycle to another is eliminated by scanning at longer exposure time in the beginning with subsequently decreasing exposure times in later cycles. Sequence of markers, antibody concentration, and exposure time were rearranged to minimize carry over signal in subsequent cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ciobq","text":"Deconvolution and extended field of depth","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4esr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmusi","text":"Enabling deconvolution reduces out of focus light to yield sharp images. Extended field of depth feature collapses all z-stacks into a single best focus image.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flqd8","text":"Shading correction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50ebr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"295hu","text":"Optical vignetting is corrected using BaSiC, a retrospective method for estimating flat-field and correcting microscopy images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qk81","text":"Segmentation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epiqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpotg","text":"Segmentation involves two steps, finding local maxima and region-growing using the maxima as seed points. Threshold values can be specified by the user to control the region growth. Key segmentation parameters affecting segmentation were radius and cut off range. Radius represents radius of local maxima search, which then serves as the kernel for a region growing algorithm. Decreasing the radius may improve the separation of clumped cells. Cut off range is the threshold for local maxima search. From the peak, the cell volume is grown by adding neighboring voxels whose intensities are between the minimum and maximum cutoff. For example, for 16-bit images, the range is 0 ~ 65,535, so the cutoff range would be 1,310 ~ 64,879. These thresholds aim to eliminate overexposure or low signal indistinct from the background. Images are segmented based on nuclear stain from cycle 2 using water-shed algorithm. Optimal segmentation parameters were found to be radius 6, with cut off range between 0.02 and 0.99. Segmentation settings were optimized to enhance segmentation efficiency by capturing as many true cells while minimizing false segmentation. Quality control gating was used to complement segmentation and eliminate false segmentation artifacts where feasible. Optimized segmentation parameters were validated in multiple CODEX experiments and is now implemented for all CODEX data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekflj","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14ju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1F404270F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":211.58145363408522,"id":223205,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fq7ka","text":"Segmentation mask showing nuclear signal based cell segmentation","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 7.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39hbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39fbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39gbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39ebbgep.webp","width":228.1648648648649}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eclh1","text":"Quality control gating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s9ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0n7j","text":"Quality control gating in MAV is used to eliminate artifacts by retaining sample or region of interest only. Very small image objects and artifacts causing false segmentation are eliminated by DAPI and size QC gating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p54b","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jnil","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4jev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51C3A020F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":218,"id":223209,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 8.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39mbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39jbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39kbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39ibbgep.webp","width":428.2142857142858}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5881B320F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":201,"id":223213,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e1j3j","text":"Quality control gating to eliminate artifacts and false segmentation","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 9.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39rbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39pbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39qbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39nbbgep.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51u1v","text":"Manual gating of population","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgunl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4phb0","text":"Populations were generated by manual gating for each marker of interest. Minimum and maximum threshold values for respective markers were adjusted until all cells with desired marker intensity were gated. When marker intensity was low, structural context information was used to set gating threshold thus yielding high accuracy of gating. These markers/populations could be classified as positive or negative. Markers such as CD45, CD38, CD3 displayed wide range of expression level and pattern resulting in multi-dimensional variation. In such cases gating threshold was set to maximize specificity while avoiding potential noise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ciet8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47o9a","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ugbl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aode2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"789A67B0F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":257.050909090909,"id":223217,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7tkth","text":"Aquaporin1 can be easily gated by setting intensity threshold as there is no background noise and robust signal","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 10.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39vbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39tbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39ubbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g39sbbgep.webp","width":271.358925143954}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"87AA9B30F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":247.24000000000007,"id":223221,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"67q11","text":"CD45 expression is robust with wide range of expression","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image gating of CD3+ population by setting marker intensity threshold to include or exclude population with desired expression","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 12.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g395bbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g393bbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g394bbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g392bbgep.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: CODEX Image Compartmental Segmentation (Clustering) of the Biopsy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bae9k","text":"Once the cellular population with individual markers were generated, the kidney biopsies were compartmentalized based on some of the main anatomical-structural compartments of the kidney e.g., glomeruli, tubulointerstitium and vessels (arteries and arterioles). Compartmental clustering took place with the help of phenotypical markers using manual annotation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CODEX Image Compartmental Segmentation (Clustering) of the Biopsy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8l06","text":"Glomerular compartment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5oo9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jgv1","text":"Glomeruli were highlighted using synaptopodin and ROIs were created using polygon section tool around the edge of the glomeruli. This process was performed for every glomerulus in the biopsy. All the glomeruli were combined using “combine (union)” function in MAV to create glomerular compartment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83a84","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bji2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2E07390F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":274.5545454545452,"id":223229,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 13.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g399bbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g397bbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g398bbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g396bbgep.webp","width":331.8791208791206}}}}

steps.section: CODEX Image Compartmental Segmentation (Clustering) of the Biopsy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3pp00","text":"Arterial and arteriolar compartment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn5ce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cihtd","text":"Arteries and arterioles were highlighted using synaptopodin and CD31. These structures were identified when synaptopodin was interspersed among smooth muscle cells with inner most lining of CD31+ endothelial cells. All the arteries and arterioles were combined using “combine (union)” function in MAV to create arterial and arteriolar population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9eab","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"89f88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EDFD5E90F60011EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":271.5800000000001,"id":223233,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 14.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4adbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4abbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4acbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4aabbgep.webp","width":326.8468271334793}}}}

steps.section: CODEX Image Compartmental Segmentation (Clustering) of the Biopsy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8dd2q","text":"Tubulointerstitial compartment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61j44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eif4t","text":"Glomerular and arterial/arteriolar compartment were sequentially subtracted from all the cells (obtained post QC gating), using “set difference” function in MAV to yield tubulointerstitial compartment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vb7","text":"Total cellular population in each compartment was estimated for each biopsy. Predominant population in each compartment was estimated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4etu","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"22ff3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0AB4BFB0F60111EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":275.4490909090909,"id":223237,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 15.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4ahbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4afbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4agbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4aebbgep.webp","width":331.5032822757111}}}}

steps.section: CODEX Image Compartmental Segmentation (Clustering) of the Biopsy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4das0","text":"Biaxial gating of coexpressing population","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lbs3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cts8","text":"Unique coexpressing population were identified by biaxial gating where populations were manually gated using two specific markers. Resultant double positive population were quality checked to determine if those gated as double positive were true positive or merely due to proximity. All false positive population were manually selected using selection tools in MAV and combined as false positive population. Only overlapping double positive population were considered true population and marked using selection tool in MAV. Either the false positive population were subtracted from double positive population using “set difference” function in MAV to yield true population. Or, alternatively only true positive population from double positive population were selected and retained using “intersection” function in MAV.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bg5v9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"48la9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"21FA8B00F60111EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":394.8533333333335,"id":223241,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dbfor","text":"MAV features used for manual gating","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 16.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4ambbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4ajbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4akbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4aibbgep.webp","width":343.6827852998067}}}}

steps.section: CODEX Defining cell populations based on combined phenotypical profiles
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6e5r","text":"Cell populations were also generated based on phenotypic profiles. All CD45+ cells were populated as inflammatory cells. A subset of these CD45+ cells were also CD3+ and hence designated as T lymphocytes. CD45+CD3+ T lymphocytes were subclassified using biaxial gating in subsequent child plot. T helper cells were gated by CD3+CD4+ biaxial gating while T cytotoxic cells were gated using CD3+CD8+.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u3h2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8j8ds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4BB20450F60111EBBAF41762E6F8E219","height":275.94000000000005,"id":223245,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"36oas","text":"Biaxial gating following CD3 gating to generate CD3+CD4+ T helper cells","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CODEX protocol image 17.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4arbbgep.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4apbbgep.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4aqbbgep.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/g4anbbgep.webp","width":242.0526315789472}}}}
